title: Junglers have way to much say in my lane.
body: The game goes one of two ways, you get a good jungler and win or a bad one and lose. I'm sick of level 1 ganks and being camped with the jungler having no to cost to him. He is called Jungler, not ganker, not camper, not duo top, he is called jungler. They need to be punished anytime they gank and make it so they have to weigh their options on ganking. I don't want to see them sitting in my lane not actually doing anything and still staying relevant.

Taking the enemy junglers camps, taking objectives, or ganking other lanes are all things your jungler can do to punish the enemy jungler.

what if both junglers are good tho
the game actually becomes fair :)

Junglers do need to see a sgnificant power drop across the role.

Like compare playing with a bad jungler to a bad any other role, you'll see how too much influence it has, junglers need to be same gold/exp as a duo lane, not solo, and any kind of catchup mechanics need to be removed, if a jungler camps a lane too much and doesnt get 20 kills out of it he should be same lvl as bot lane if not lower, not same lvl as a solo.

Riot is way too biased towards junglers though so have fun playing a jungle dominated game for more years to come.

Your not the better top laner if you lost your lane because "your jungler is worse than your enemies"

There are times where you outfarm the enemy top laner by 20+ CS, can beat them down if they try to fight you, and you're easily capable of knocking the turret down yourself.

Then the jungler comes in once.

You're still ahead in minions. He gained a level but you still have 1 over him. Middle of the lane, farming.

Jungler comes in again.

Leves are matching, he's still lower CS than you. However, since he got two kills from the jungler, he decides to fight you. *You still beat him despite the kill lead and he starts to run away.*

Jungler comes in again and kills you. The enemy closes the farm gap because you're still dead, knocks a chunk of the tower's health bar.

You teleport back into lane, farm under tower. During this, the enemy laner recalls and teleports back. Move up a little past tower range, the enemy laner engages you and kills you because you were set behind by the enemy jungler.

---------------------------------------------------

There are times where the enemy laner is simply a worse player than you, in every respect, but you have no say in the matter because of the enemy jungler. A lane's fate should not be solely decided because an enemy jungler decided to visit you a few times. You can be a much better laner than the enemy, this means nothing if the enemy is set ahead by another player on their team. A lot of the time, there's nothing you can do to stop it either. Zac can engage from unusual spots, one of his niches, and still lock you down and deal a good amount of damage. Even if they have to dive, they can still kill you safely. Lee sin can land a Q on you, ward hop behind and ult you into the enemy laner, then Q again. Unless you flash before lee sin ults, you can't do anything. He already decided you're going to die, and you're just going to have to live with it. He can knock you out of tower range and kill you with his laner.

It's no fun to have no power in a situation. Only a select few champions can survive lane ganks, you shouldn't have to play them just because the jungler *might* decide to visit often. Also, wards will often mean you survive, yes, but the enemy laner still gets free farm off of this. You can come back a moment later, the enemy jungler comes back a moment later, you have to retreat again and the enemy keeps farming, closing any lead you may have had with farm instead of kills. 

It's incredibly frustrating.
Happens in mid too

You put yourself into a position where you could be ganked and killed SEVERAL times. Yeah junglers can help win a losing lane (you know, their job) but a thing about junglers is if you know how they gank, you can make them barely appear in your lane.

My main problem is when people complain about junglers being gank heavy, its their job. If you are being camped, odds are you are putting yourself IN that position.

And yes junglers can be strong, but their strength is depending on how easily they can gank you when you play it correctly. Like at the start of the year {{champion:120}} {{champion:254}} and {{champion:64}} being able to repeatedly dive you when you are at full health under turret. Thats a strong jungler and they probably should be nerfed.

BUT if you know how to avoid the jungler, than most of the issues people have been complaining about are just invalid.

They need to put a shield on bot turret as well.. I know I speak for a majority of the community when I say " Sick of 3 minutes into the game being forced to sit under tower because the jungler decides to camp bot because the tower can be taken by 5 minutes into the game..
We had multiple topics on front page about how turrets are weak,Riot is not listening!

They're listening, but listening doesn't mean replying or doing something about it. For all we know they're happy with the way it is and see no need to change it, or they're working on solutions right now but can't share it. Riot doesn't like sharing things unless they're going to happen, since everyone here takes ideas as promises and then holds Riot to them.

The thing is that real balance will never be achieved. You are all asking the wrong question. 
The correct question is this:
"What is the ratio of jungling and ganking that would be optimal. A 50/50 split isnt feasible. And leaning to one side or the other too much is also off the table.  So where should it sit then?"
As a jungler I agree and I would honestly prefer to haave a farming option, but that is not exciting for pro-play.

Maybe they should make it so camps are weaker, but spawn more often (with less gold/exp of course).  This way, time spent on failed ganks is a much more direct loss in farm.

Basically, if it were possible for junglers to literally constantly be farming (as an extreme version), then any time spent not farming is (obviously) lost farm.
